```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(plotrix)
library(devtools)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggthemes)

datensatz <- readRDS("LindaSinani/robo_pflege.rds")
rwthfarben <- hcictools::rwth.colorpalette()
```

```{r}
devtools::install_github("HCIC/r-tools")
rwthfarben <- hcictools::rwth.colorpalette()
# Balkendiagramm (Jobtyp und robo_hair_cut)
datensatz %>% 
filter(job_type != "keine Angabe") %>% 
group_by(job_type) %>%   
summarise(robo_hair_cut_m = mean(robo_hair_cut_m, na.rm = TRUE)-1, robo_hair_cut_sem = std.error(robo_hair_cut)) %>% 
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = job_type, weight = robo_hair_cut_m, ymin = robo_hair_cut_m-robo_hair_cut_sem , ymax = robo_hair_cut_m+robo_hair_cut_sem, fill = job_type) +
  
  geom_bar(fill = c(rwthfarben$bordeaux, rwthfarben$yellow, rwthfarben$magenta, rwthfarben$blue, rwthfarben$pet)) +
  
  geom_errorbar(width = 0.5) +
  
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,5)) +
 
  
  labs(x = "Jobtyp",
      y = "Anzahl der Zustimmungen",
      title = "Jobtyp nimmt keinen Einfluss auf die Akzeptanz", 
      subtitle = "Balkendiagramm zu den Jobtypen",
      caption = "Fehlerindikatoren zeigen Standardfehler f√ºr den Mittelwert an") +
 theme_fivethirtyeight()
NULL
ggsave("Diagramm_SinaniGessel.pdf", width = 210, height = 297, units = "mm")
```
